title: Drawing, "Tapestry desigh of Trude and John as Landscape for Project "Faces"", ca. 1974
medium: Graphite, blue color pencil on tracing paper
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite at top center:  arrow pointing upward with horizontal line over it and to the right, the word "sky"
provenance: Eric Elsesser, California; 1993: acquired by Museum
dimensions: H x W (irregular): 43 x 35.2 cm (16 15/16 x 13 7/8 in.)
creditline: Gift of Mr. Eric and Mrs. Sylvia Elsesser, The Trude Guermonprez Archives
description: Tapestry design based on profiles of Trude Guermonprez and John Elsesser embedded in the landscape.  The profile of John, forming the mountains, appears twice at the top facing left and right.  The profile of Trude is beneath forming the hills and valleys

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, "Tapestry desigh of Trude and John as Landscape for Project "Faces"", ca. 1974.Graphite, blue color pencil on tracing paper. Gift of Mr. Eric and Mrs. Sylvia Elsesser, The Trude Guermonprez Archives. 1993-121-107.
